LOGIN TO YOUR ACCOUNT Register for Online Access Password Reset Download the Mobile App Pay Now SmartHub Login Outage Map Contact Us Newsletter Load Control Status - East River Welcome Welcome to Lake Region Electric Association, Inc., Your local Touchstone Energy¬Æ Cooperative. Lake Region Electric is a member-owned electric cooperative located in northeastern South Dakota in the beautiful Coteau Hills. We are a distributor of low-cost electric service to our member-owners. We do business with accountability, integrity, innovation, and commitment to community. As an electric co-op, we are motivated by service to our members, not by profit. Lake Region Electric is a member-owned electric cooperative that distributes electricity to homes, businesses and farmsteads in northeastern South Dakota. Our Service territory. We do business with accountability, integrity, innovation, and commitment to community. As an electric cooperative, we are motivated by service to our members, not by profit. Lake Region Conducts ACSI Survey Thursday | February 1, 2024 Read more > Contact us Office Location: 1212 Main Street Webster, SD Hours: 8:00 A.M. until 4:30 P.M. (Mon-Fri) Phone: 605-345-3379 or 1-800-657-5869 24 Hour Dispatch / 7 Days a Week LREA functions to safely purchase, transmit and distribute electric energy and provide services to its members. 1212 Main St .                 providing high quality, comprehensive health care in the
                Central Florida region. We strive to forge a special
                relationship with each and every patient we see. As
                primary care doctors, we are here to take care of people
                of all ages and circumstances. Our goal is to be your
                partner on the road to wellness and excellent health. CONVENIENT LOCATION We are located conveniently near the intersection of US Hwy 27 and Grand Hwy. Our Board and Advisors - Village Enterprise What We Do What We Do Overview Our Model Where We Work Who We Serve Partnerships for Scale DREAMS for Refugees Impact First Initiative Technology and Innovation Our Impact Our Impact Overview Theory of Change Research & Evidence Monitoring & Evaluation Recognition for Impact About About Us Overview Our Story Team Board & Advisors Partners and Funders Financials & Reports Careers Press Room Blog Take Action Take Action Overview Ways to Give Donate What We Do Overview Our Model Where We Work Who We Serve Partnerships for Scale DREAMS for Refugees Impact First Initiative Technology and Innovation Our Impact Overview Theory of Change Research & Evidence Monitoring & Evaluation Recognition for Impact About Overview Our Story Team Board & Advisors Partners and Funders Financials & Reports Careers Press Room Blog Take Action Overview Ways to Give Blog Press Room Join Our Team Contact Us Subscribe to News Search Our Board & Advisors Working toward our vision of a world free of extreme poverty, our Board of Directors and Advisory Council are integral to this goal Our Board of Directors and Advisory Council are made up of industry leaders, innovators, and founders who are highly respected in their fields. Board of Directors Advisory Council Board of Directors Emeka Ajoku Board Treasurer; Director of Product at Netflix Jamie Austin Board Secretary; Former Senior Director of Impact at Tipping Point Community Pat Brown Business Trainer and Management Consultant Dianne Calvi CEO and President U.S. Mary Dosunmu Associate Director, Scientific Review at Sage Therapeutics Jay Friedrichs General Partner of the Cyprus Growth Fund Lisa Guerra Silicon Valley Social Venture Fund Partner Debbie Hall Board Vice Chair; Management Consultant Serah Kimani Founder and Managing Partner of Ascend Group Michael Mithika CEO and Founder of Mizizi Partners Evelyn Namara Senior Partnerships Manager and Researcher at the Global Digital Inclusion Partnership, Founder and CEO of Vouch Aleksandra Peters Chief People Officer at Brightline Alexis Rwabizambuga Managing Director at TestandCare Medical Technologies Ltd. Bruce Sewell Board Chair; Former Senior Vice President and General Counsel at Apple Advisory Council Tralance Addy Founder and President, Plebys International; Former Founding Executive Director at SEED Brian Boland Co-founder of the Delta Fund Charlie Bresler Board Member and former Executive Director of The Life You Can Save Joe Dougherty Partner at Dalberg Advisors Ermias Eshetu CEO of Financial Sector Deepening (FSD) Ethiopia Jessica Jackley Founder of Alltruists, General Partner at Untapped Capital, and Co-founder of KIVA Amit Maheshwari SaaS Entrepreneur and Founder, Social Technology Partners Our Team Learn about the people that continue the legacy of Village Enterprise Our Team Discover how entrepreneurship can end extreme poverty. Certifications Search for: Lake Country Village Providing a well-maintained community with sound fiscal management and open communications. BOARD PLACES MORATORIUM ON NEW LEVEL II EV CHARGERS EFFECTIVE 1/9/2023! Click here for more information About Us LAKE COUNTRY VILLAGE is the largest homeowners association in Clinton County with 326 homes. Constructed¬†in 1959¬†by the United States Air Force for use as personal housing, our homes were extensively renovated and upgraded at the time of the PAFB closing in 1995. Located minutes from the Plattsburgh International¬†Airport , the Adirondack Northway and Lake Champlain . ¬†LCV¬†is composed of townhouse and villa style homes. ¬†Situated ideally within the City of Plattsburgh ,¬†LCV is easily accessible to shopping, schools, restaurants, bike paths and all¬†the Lake City has to offer. HOMEOWNERS ASSOCIATION BOARD OF DIRECTORS The Lake Country Village HOA is guided by a group of¬†dedicated homeowners¬†who sit on its Board of Directors.¬†¬†The Board works earnestly to ensure residents‚Äô needs are addressed, our community life is safe, clean and consistently improving. ¬†Please join our monthly meetings- generally the 2nd and 4th Monday of each month.¬† Dates, times and locations are posted on the website calendar page. Our Board members support LCV¬†on a volunteer basis. All elected Board members serve 2 yr. terms, and may opt to run again once their commitment is up. Special skills or past experience is helpful but certainly not required.¬† Many Board members have never served on a Board before and are just regular residents who care about their neighborhood. While good organizational skills are important, patience and open-mindedness are the most important qualities of a board member as we deal with homeowners questions, concerns and complaints. Board business requires a minimum of approximately a 3-5 hr. commitment each month, which can increase as issues or changes arise. Board Members are expected to attend all Board Meetings and are encouraged to serve as a Board Liaison to one of our HOA committees. COMMITTEES In addition to the Board, homeowners are encouraged to volunteer to help by joining one of our committees that are organized to study, research and advise the Board in a variety of specialized areas.¬† If you feel you can contribute your time and talent to help out in this way, please visit our Join a Committee page and fill out the form. Committee involvement is extremely valuable and appreciated ‚Äì¬†the more people we have dedicated to helping the community proactively, the better we are today and in the future. MEETINGS Our Board meetings are¬†generally held the 2nd and, when needed, the 4th Monday of each month.¬† Dates, times and locations are posted on the website calendar page.¬† All homeowners are encouraged to attend to stay informed and to lend your voice in the decisions for your community. HOA FEES Currently, the monthly¬†member fees¬†are $245.¬†¬†This amount covers (but is not limited to) homeowners‚Äô water and sewer charges, roof replacements, structure insurance and common area maintenance including lawn care, and snow removal.¬†¬†The Board tries to maintain this amount as low as possible by continuously looking for ways to save expenses without compromising the quality of the neighborhood.¬† We¬†use our various committees to investigate ways to save such as Utilities Committee to monitor water usage.¬† The day-to-day operation of the HOA is handled by a professional Property Manager, which as of April 1, 2024 is : Michael Mckinno n ( prop ertymanager@lcvillage.org ) QUESTIONS? Usually, questions should be directed to our property manager.¬† However, you can contact the Board members at any time at:  board@lcvillage.org.¬† Or you can use the Contact Us form by clicking here .¬† The entire Board receives this form when submitted.  We are elected to represent your interests and concerns. Tammy Favro, President Ron Deragon, Vice President Jody Erickson, Treasurer Judy Barcomb, Secretary Dale Holzer, MAL Gerry Eagan, MAL Home LCV News Calendar Gallery Documents Agendas Board Minutes Last 10 years 2025 Board Minutes 2024 Board Minutes 2023 Board Minutes 2022 Board Minutes 2021 Board Minutes 2020 Board Minutes 2019 Board Minutes 2018 Board Minutes 2017 Board Minutes 2016 Board Minutes 2015 Board Minutes 2014 Board Minutes Older than 10 years 2013 Board Minutes 2012 Board Minutes 2011 Board Minutes 2010 Board Minutes 2009 Board Minutes 2008 Board Minutes 2007 Board Minutes 2006 Board Minutes 2005 Board Minutes 2004 Board Minutes 2003 Board Minutes 2002 Board Minutes Policies and Procedures Common Area Tree and Shrub Policy Contract Guidelines Elections Ethics and Code of Conduct Policy Expense Authorization Policy HOA Dues Kiosks Records Retention Water Use Work Requests Declaration and Other Legal Documents Declaration By Laws and Regulations Prospectus Resolutions Building Communications Contracts Insurance Landscaping Rules and Regulations Homeowners Dues Outside Storage Parking Rentals Website Work Requests Other Utilities Other Documents Annual Reports and Newsletters Insurance Documents HOA Dues Maps COVID-19 Your HOA About Us Maps Your Board Committees/Duties Current Committee Members Join a Committee?? MHBO is not responsible for quoting current monthly fees,
          lot rent, or any dues/fees associated with the community or home. Additional fees for certain amenity privileges may apply.
          All applicable community fees are the responsibility of the buyer to obtain and community manager/owner to disclose prior to ownership or occupancy. Description Lake Region Village is an age-restricted (55+) manufactured home community located in 31850 U.S. Highway 27 South, Haines City, FL 33844. Lake Region Village is a land-lease community and has a total of 611 home sites. Home site lot rent ranges from $360 - $740 per month and includes the following: Trash pickup Water Sewer The streets in the community are paved, and are of an wide street width. The water in the community is sourced from the city and the sewer system is city provided. Parking is off-street The community has 0 parking spaces available for RVs. Lake Region Village is an affordable housing choice for active, friendly, age-qualified living. This well-maintained retirement community has easy access to local recreation, shopping and entertainment. Equal Housing Opportunity Amenities check Basketball court check Billiards check Bingo check Boat storage check Fitness center check Horseshoes check Clubhouse check Recreation facilities check Shuffleboard courts check Swimming pool check Laundry facilities check Library check Fishing check Kitchen check Picnic area check Cards check RV Storage Area check Putting Green check Meeting Rooms check Planned Activities check On-Site Sales Office check On-Site Staff check Potluck MORE Local Climate HOT-HUMID Lake Region Village is located in Climate Zone 1.
      A HOT-HUMID climate is defined as a region that receives more than 20 inches (50 cm) of annual precipitation, and where the monthly average outdoor temperature remains above 67¬∞F (19.5¬∞C) throughout the year. Knowing your area‚Äôs climate zone (as assigned by the U.S. Department of Energy‚Äôs Building America Program into one of eight zones), can help you predict your heating and cooling needs. Humidity and temperature can of course vary, even by county. The Building America HOT-HUMID climate zone corresponds to the portions of IECC zones 2 and 3 in the dry category. for certain features Search Lake Region Village Dundee, FL If you go to Dundee, Florida and turn east off US Highway 27, you will find a true Florida ‚Äúhidden treasure.‚Äù Far enough away from the hubbub of traffic for a quiet, peaceful, pet-friendly community, you‚Äôll find extra wide streets, lots of friendly neighbors, and a quiet place to fish. Dell Lake Village is a 55+ community with its own lake. Our many amenities include a great club house, a large heated pool, shuffleboard courts and billiards. There are several nearby golf courses and plenty of shopping. The clubhouse and pool overlook the lake. This is a very social active community. Near by is a regional shopping mall, restaurants, Home Depot, and a large flea market. There are many outstanding golf courses and driving ranges close by. Disney and the other Orlando theme parks are 45 minutes away. Orlando International Airport is an hour away as are the Tampa Bay area beaches. The park is located just off Route 27 North of Dundee Rd. Turn right onto Frederick Ave. off Rt. 27 and drive approximately one half mile. You will find the park on the right at 314 Frederick Ave. Community Features Clubhouse Bingo Shuffleboard Heated Pool Planned Community Activities Pool Table Library Boat and Camper Storage Area Lake for Boating & Fishing Around the Town Things to do Disney World Universal Studios Sea World Places to Shop Winn-Dixie Family Dollar Wal-Mart Supercenter Services Nearby Winter Haven Hospital Moffit Cancer Center Dundee Walk-in Clinic Agents Serving this Community Listings in this Community View Property 223 Green Haven: Perfect Snowbird Living!
